alert.note: Alert for Hamilton; Montgomery; Northern Fulton; Northern Herkimer; Southern Fulton; Southern Herkimer (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 29 at 8:07PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...SNOW SHOWERS WITH EMBEDDED SNOW SQUALLS WILL AFFECT PARTS OF SOUTHERN FULTON...NORTHERN HERKIMER...HAMILTON...NORTHERN FULTON...SOUTHERN HERKIMER...AND MONTGOMERY COUNTIES... HAZARDS...Snow showers and embedded snow squalls were accompanied by winds of up to 45 MPH which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than a quarter of a mile. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 804 PM EDT, snow showers and some snow squalls were along a line extending from 7 miles southeast of Star Lake to 7 miles northwest of Stratford to near Exeter Center and moving southeast at 50 MPH. THE SNOW SHOWERS AND SNOW SQUALLS WILL BE NEAR... Dolgeville around 810 PM EDT. Stratford around 815 PM EDT. Caroga Lake and Caroga Lake Public Campground around 825 PM EDT. Lake Eaton Campground and Forked Lake Public Campground around 830 PM EDT. Gloversville, Johnstown and Blue Mountain Lake around 835 PM EDT. Fonda, Mayfield, Lake Durant Campground, Tribes Hill and Cranberry Creek around 840 PM EDT. Indian Lake, Broadalbin and Fort Johnson around 845 PM EDT. This includes Interstate 90 between exits 28 and 30. SAFETY INFO... Use extra caution if you must travel into or through these snow showers and squalls. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads may lead to accidents. &&

area.areaDesc: Hamilton; Montgomery; Northern Fulton; Northern Herkimer; Southern Fulton; Southern Herkimer
